channel.title: Ranger-Revised touch ups
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Ranger-Revised touch ups" - adding and updating its linked subclasses

item.title: Re: Ranger-Revised touch ups
item.content:encoded: The stated reason for having extra attack be a subclass feature was specifically just for the beast master, since it didnt get extra attack to compensate for the damage output the companion gave

item.title: Re: Ranger-Revised touch ups
item.content:encoded: I believe I added in the Extra Attack feature with (UA) next to it to every ranger subclass, but this is fine as well. I don't know why revised ranger does that, because every revised subclass gives extra attack, but whatever

item.title: Ranger-Revised touch ups
item.content:encoded:
Id like to begin by noting that ranger revised links to every single one of the current ranger subclasses, however, I do not believe this to be the best option. Despite ranger and ranger revised being very similiar, ranger revised is built in such a way that it does not interact well with the base game subclasses. For example, it lacks extra-attack, due to it being reliant on its subclasses to give it the feature, so as to balance alterations to beast master.

As such, I have decided to remove these links from the ranger-revised page.

Aswell, I have noticed that the revised rangers actual subclasses, Beastmaster(revised), Hunter (revised) and Gloomstalker(Revised) lack pages. Technically the beastmaster has a page, at http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/ranger:beast-master-new, however the page is empty

As such, I have added and linked the revised rangers page to the following in place of its old links:

http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/revised-ranger-ua:beast-master
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/revised-ranger-ua:hunter
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/revised-ranger-ua:deep-stalker
